prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with no rotation. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a circle using the center point at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.375. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.2812 units. Part 2 Create a new coordinate system at the translated position [0.0375, 0.0375, 0.2812]. No rotation is needed. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a circle using the center point at (0.3375, 0.3375) and a radius of 0.3375. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0375, 0.0375, 0.2812]. Extrude the 2D sketch in the opposite direction of the Z-axis by 0.2438 units. This will create a cut in the previous part. Part 3 Create a new coordinate system at the translated position [0.3094, 0.3094, 0.0375]. No rotation is needed. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create the first circle with center point at (0.0656, 0.0656) and radius of 0.0656. Create a second circle with the same center point and radius of 0.0281. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.3094, 0.3094, 0.0375]. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.3 units. This will join the previous part and create a hole in the combined object. Part 4 Create a new coordinate system at the translated position [0.0562, 0.6938, 0.0] with rotation around the Z-axis as 180 degrees. Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane. Create a circle using the center point at (0.3188, 0.3188) and a radius of 0.3188. Create another circle with the same center point and radius of 0.3094. Do not transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch. Extrude the first circle in the opposite direction of the Z-axis by 0.0188 units. This will create a cut in the previous part. Measure the dimensions of each part. Part 1 has length, width, and height of 0.75, 0.75, and 0.2812 units, respectively. Part 2 has length, width, and height of 0.675, 0.675, and 0.2438 units, respectively. Part 3 has length, width, and height of 0.1313, 0.1313, and 0.3 units, respectively. Part 4 has length, width, and height of 0.6375, 0.6375, and 0.0187 units, respectively. The final assembly will have the same dimensions as Part 1.</description>
